anyhow::Result&lt;Self&gt; {\n        let mut child = Command::new(command)\n            .args(args)\n            .stdin(Stdio::piped())\n            .stdout(Stdio::piped())\n            .stderr(Stdio::inherit())\n            .spawn()?;\n        \n        let stdin = child.stdin.take().unwrap();\n        let stdout = BufReader::new(child.stdout.take().unwrap());\n        \n        Ok(Self {\n            child,\n            stdin,\n            stdout,\n            request_id: 1,\n        })\n    }\n    \n    pub async fn call_tool(&amp;mut self, tool_name: &amp;str, params: Value) -&gt; anyhow::Result&lt;Value&gt; {\n        let request = JsonRpcRequest {\n            jsonrpc: \&quot;2.0\&quot;,\n            id: self.request_id,\n            method: format!(\&quot;tools/{}\&quot;, tool_name),\n            params: Some(params),\n        };\n        \n        self.request_id += 1;\n        \n        // Send request\n        let request_json = serde_json::to_string(&amp;request)?;\n        self.stdin.write_all(request_json.as_bytes()).await?;\n        self.stdin.write_all(b\&quot;\\n\&quot;).await?;\n        self.stdin.flush().await?;\n        \n        // Read response\n        let mut line = String::new();\n        self.stdout.read_line(&amp;mut line).await?;\n        \n        let response: JsonRpcResponse = serde_json::from_str(&amp;line)?;\n        \n        if let Some(error) = response.error {\n            anyhow::bail!(\&quot;MCP Error: {} (code {})\&quot;, error.message, error.code);\n        }\n        \n        Ok(response.result.unwrap_or(Value::Null))\n    }\n    \n    pub async fn shutdown(mut self) -&gt; anyhow::Result&lt;()&gt; {\n        drop(self.stdin);\n        drop(self.stdout);\n        self.child.wait().await?;\n        Ok(())\n    }\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**File**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/lib.rs&#96;\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;rust\npub mod mcp; anyhow::Result&lt;Self&gt; {\n        let mut child = Command::new(command)\n            .args(args)\n            .stdin(Stdio::piped())\n            .stdout(Stdio::piped())\n            .stderr(Stdio::inherit())\n            .spawn()?;\n        \n        let stdin = child.stdin.take().unwrap();\n        let stdout = BufReader::new(child.stdout.take().unwrap());\n        \n        Ok(Self {\n            child,\n            stdin,\n            stdout,\n            request_id: 1,\n        })\n    }\n    \n    pub async fn call_tool(&amp;mut self, tool_name: &amp;str, params: Value) -&gt; anyhow::Result&lt;Value&gt; {\n        let request = JsonRpcRequest {\n            jsonrpc: \&quot;2.0\&quot;,\n            id: self.request_id,\n            method: format!(\&quot;tools/{}\&quot;, tool_name),\n            params: Some(params),\n        };\n        \n        self.request_id += 1;\n        \n        // Send request\n        let request_json = serde_json::to_string(&amp;request)?;\n        self.stdin.write_all(request_json.as_bytes()).await?;\n        self.stdin.write_all(b\&quot;\\n\&quot;).await?;\n        self.stdin.flush().await?;\n        \n        // Read response\n        let mut line = String::new();\n        self.stdout.read_line(&amp;mut line).await?;\n        \n        let response: JsonRpcResponse = serde_json::from_str(&amp;line)?;\n        \n        if let Some(error) = response.error {\n            anyhow::bail!(\&quot;MCP Error: {} (code {})\&quot;, error.message, error.code);\n        }\n        \n        Ok(response.result.unwrap_or(Value::Null))\n    }\n    \n    pub async fn shutdown(mut self) -&gt; anyhow::Result&lt;()&gt; {\n        drop(self.stdin);\n        drop(self.stdout);\n        self.child.wait().await?;\n        Ok(())\n    }\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**File**: &#96;codex-rs/core/src/lib.rs&#96;\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;rust\npub mod mcp; anyhow::Result&lt;()&gt; {\n    let stdin = std::io::stdin();\n    let mut stdout = std::io::stdout();\n    \n    for line in stdin.lock().lines() {\n        let line = line?;\n        let request: Value = serde_json::from_str(&amp;line)?;\n        \n        if let Some(method) = request[\&quot;method\&quot;].as_str() {\n            if method == \&quot;tools/execute_prompt\&quot; + use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use clap::Parser;
+ use codex_core::orchestration::{
+     AgentTask, AgentType, ParallelOrchestrator, TaskStatus,
+ };
+ use owo_colors::OwoColorize;
+ use std::time::Instant;
+ 
+ /// CLI arguments for parallel execution
+ #[derive(Debug, Parser)]
+ pub struct ParallelCli {
+     /// Prompts to execute in parallel (can be specified multiple times)
+     #[clap(short, long, required = true)]
+     pub prompts: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+ 
+     /// Agent type for each prompt (codex/gemini/claude)
+     /// If fewer agents than prompts, the last agent type is used for remaining prompts
+     #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;codex&quot;)]
+     pub agents: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+ 
+     /// Maximum concurrent executions (default: auto-detect based on CPU cores)
+     #[clap(long)]
+     pub max_concurrent: Option&lt;usize&gt;,
+ 
+     /// Enable worktree isolation (creates separate git worktrees for each agent)
+     #[clap(long)]
+     pub use_worktrees: bool,
+ }
+ 
+ pub async fn run_parallel(cli: ParallelCli) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let start_time = Instant::now();
+ 
+     println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;ğŸš€ Parallel Execution Mode&quot;.bold().cyan());
+     println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;â”€&quot;.repeat(60).dimmed());
+ 
+     // Parse agent types
+     let agent_types: Vec&lt;AgentType&gt; = cli
+         .agents
+         .iter()
+         .map(|s| parse_agent_type(s))
+         .collect();
+ 
+     // Create tasks
+     let mut tasks: Vec&lt;AgentTask&gt; = Vec::new();
+     for (i, prompt) in cli.prompts.iter().enumerate() {
+         let agent = agent_types
+             .get(i)
+             .or_else(|| agent_types.last())
+             .copied()
+             .unwrap_or(AgentType::Codex);
+ 
+         tasks.push(AgentTask {
+             id: format!(&quot;task-{}&quot;, i + 1),
+             agent,
+             prompt: prompt.clone(),
+             status: TaskStatus::Pending,
+             progress: 0.0,
+             result: None,
+         });
+     }
+ 
+     println!(
+         &quot;  ğŸ“‹ Tasks:     {}&quot;,
+         tasks.len().to_string().bright_yellow()
+     );
+     println!(
+         &quot;  ğŸ¤– Agents:    {}&quot;,
+         format_agent_distribution(&amp;tasks).bright_cyan()
+     );
+ 
+     if let Some(max) = cli.max_concurrent {
+         println!(
+             &quot;  âš™ï¸  Max Parallel: {}&quot;,
+             max.to_string().bright_green()
+         );
+     }
+ 
+     if cli.use_worktrees {
+         println!(&quot;  ğŸŒ² Worktrees: {}&quot;, &quot;enabled&quot;.bright_green());
+     }
+ 
+     println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;â”€&quot;.repeat(60).dimmed());
+     println!();
+ 
+     // Initialize orchestrator
+     let orchestrator = ParallelOrchestrator::with_repo_path(&quot;.&quot;)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to initialize orchestrator&quot;)?;
+ 
+     // Execute tasks
+     println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;âš¡ Executing tasks...&quot;.bright_yellow());
+     println!();
+ 
+     let results = orchestrator
+         .execute_parallel(tasks)
+         .await
+         .context(&quot;Failed to execute parallel tasks&quot;)?;
+ 
+     // Display results
+     println!();
+     println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;âœ… Execution Complete&quot;.bold().green());
+     println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;â”€&quot;.repeat(60).dimmed());
+ 
+     for (i, result) in results.iter().enumerate() {
+         println!();
+         println!(&quot;{} {}&quot;, format!(&quot;[{}]&quot;, i + 1).bright_cyan(), result.agent);
+         println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;â”€&quot;.repeat(60).dimmed());
+ 
+         if let Some(output) = &amp;result.output {
+             // Truncate long outputs
+             let lines: Vec&lt;&amp;str&gt; = output.lines().collect();
+             let preview_lines = if lines.len() &gt; 20 {
+                 &amp;lines[..20]
+             } else {
+                 &amp;lines[..]
+             };
+ 
+             for line in preview_lines {
+                 println!(&quot;  {}&quot;, line);
+             }
+ 
+             if lines.len() &gt; 20 {
+                 println!(
+                     &quot;  {} more lines...&quot;,
+                     (lines.len() - 20).to_string().dimmed()
+                 );
+             }
+         } else if let Some(error) = &amp;result.error {
+             println!(&quot;  {}: {}&quot;, &quot;ERROR&quot;.red().bold(), error);
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     let elapsed = start_time.elapsed();
+     println!();
+     println!(
+         &quot;â±ï¸  Total time: {:.2}s&quot;,
+         elapsed.as_secs_f64().to_string().bright_magenta()
+     );
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ fn parse_agent_type(s: &amp;str) -&gt; AgentType {
+     match s.to_lowercase().as_str() {
+         &quot;codex&quot; =&gt; AgentType::Codex,
+         &quot;gemini&quot; =&gt; AgentType::Gemini,
+         &quot;claude&quot; =&gt; AgentType::Claude,
+         _ =&gt; {
+             eprintln!(
+                 &quot;âš ï¸  Unknown agent type &#39;{}&#39;, using &#39;codex&#39;&quot;,
+                 s.yellow()
+             );
+             AgentType::Codex
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ fn format_agent_distribution(tasks: &amp;[AgentTask]) -&gt; String {
+     let mut codex_count = 0;
+     let mut gemini_count = 0;
+     let mut claude_count = 0;
+ 
+     for task in tasks {
+         match task.agent {
+             AgentType::Codex =&gt; codex_count += 1,
+             AgentType::Gemini =&gt; gemini_count += 1,
+             AgentType::Claude =&gt; claude_count += 1,
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     let mut parts = Vec::new();
+     if codex_count &gt; 0 {
+         parts.push(format!(&quot;CodexÃ—{}&quot;, codex_count));
+     }
+     if gemini_count &gt; 0 {
+         parts.push(format!(&quot;GeminiÃ—{}&quot;, gemini_count));
+     }
+     if claude_count &gt; 0 {
+         parts.push(format!(&quot;ClaudeÃ—{}&quot;, claude_count));
+     }
+ 
+     parts.join(&quot;, &quot;)
+ }
+

+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use clap::Parser;
+ use codex_core::orchestration::{MergeStrategy, WorktreeManager};
+ use owo_colors::OwoColorize;
+ use uuid::Uuid;
+ 
+ /// CLI arguments for worktree management
+ #[derive(Debug, Parser)]
+ pub struct WorktreeCli {
+     #[clap(subcommand)]
+     pub command: WorktreeCommand,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, clap::Subcommand)]
+ pub enum WorktreeCommand {
+     /// Create a new worktree for parallel development
+     Create {
+         /// Name for the new worktree/branch
+         name: String,
+ 
+         /// Optional task ID (generates UUID if not provided)
+         #[clap(long)]
+         task_id: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     },
+ 
+     /// List all active worktrees
+     List,
+ 
+     /// Remove a worktree by name or path
+     Remove {
+         /// Name of the worktree to remove
+         name: String,
+ 
+         /// Force removal even if there are uncommitted changes
+         #[clap(long)]
+         force: bool,
+     },
+ 
+     /// Merge a worktree back to the main branch
+     Merge {
+         /// Name of the worktree to merge
+         name: String,
+ 
+         /// Merge strategy (squash/merge/rebase)
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;squash&quot;)]
+         strategy: String,
+ 
+         /// Skip commit quality checks
+         #[clap(long)]
+         skip_checks: bool,
+     },
+ 
+     /// Clean up all orphaned worktrees
+     Cleanup {
+         /// Dry run (show what would be cleaned up)
+         #[clap(long)]
+         dry_run: bool,
+     },
+ }
+ 
+ pub async fn run_worktree(cli: WorktreeCli) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let manager = WorktreeManager::new(&quot;.&quot;)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to initialize worktree manager&quot;)?;
+ 
+     match cli.command {
+         WorktreeCommand::Create { name, task_id } =&gt; {
+             println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;ğŸŒ² Creating worktree...&quot;.bright_cyan());
+ 
+             let tid = task_id
+                 .map(|id| Uuid::parse_str(&amp;id).context(&quot;Invalid UUID&quot;))
+                 .transpose()?
+                 .unwrap_or_else(Uuid::new_v4);
+ 
+             let info = manager
+                 .create_worktree(&amp;name, &amp;tid)
+                 .context(&quot;Failed to create worktree&quot;)?;
+ 
+             println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;âœ… Worktree created successfully!&quot;.green().bold());
+             println!();
+             println!(&quot;  Branch:   {}&quot;, info.branch_name.bright_yellow());
+             println!(&quot;  Path:     {}&quot;, info.path.display().to_string().bright_cyan());
+             println!(&quot;  Task ID:  {}&quot;, tid.to_string().dimmed());
+             println!();
+             println!(
+                 &quot;ğŸ’¡ To use this worktree: {}&quot;,
+                 format!(&quot;cd {}&quot;, info.path.display()).bright_white().bold()
+             );
+         }
+ 
+         WorktreeCommand::List =&gt; {
+             println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;ğŸŒ² Active Worktrees&quot;.bright_cyan().bold());
+             println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;â”€&quot;.repeat(80).dimmed());
+ 
+             let worktrees = manager
+                 .list_worktrees()
+                 .context(&quot;Failed to list worktrees&quot;)?;
+ 
+             if worktrees.is_empty() {
+                 println!(&quot;  No active worktrees found.&quot;);
+                 println!();
+                 println!(
+                     &quot;ğŸ’¡ Create a new worktree: {}&quot;,
+                     &quot;codex worktree create &lt;name&gt;&quot;.bright_white()
+                 );
+             } else {
+                 for (i, wt) in worktrees.iter().enumerate() {
+                     println!();
+                     println!(
+                         &quot;{}. {}&quot;,
+                         (i + 1).to_string().bright_yellow(),
+                         wt.branch_name.bright_cyan().bold()
+                     );
+                     println!(&quot;   Path:   {}&quot;, wt.path.display().to_string().dimmed());
+                 }
+                 println!();
+                 println!(&quot;  Total: {}&quot;, worktrees.len().to_string().bright_green());
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         WorktreeCommand::Remove { name, force } =&gt; {
+             println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;ğŸ—‘ï¸  Removing worktree...&quot;.bright_yellow());
+ 
+             if force {
+                 println!(&quot;  {} Force mode enabled&quot;, &quot;âš ï¸&quot;.bright_red());
+             }
+ 
+             manager
+                 .remove_worktree(&amp;name)
+                 .context(&quot;Failed to remove worktree&quot;)?;
+ 
+             println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;âœ… Worktree removed successfully!&quot;.green().bold());
+             println!(&quot;  Removed: {}&quot;, name.bright_cyan());
+         }
+ 
+         WorktreeCommand::Merge {
+             name,
+             strategy,
+             skip_checks,
+         } =&gt; {
+             println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;ğŸ”€ Merging worktree...&quot;.bright_cyan());
+ 
+             let merge_strategy = match strategy.to_lowercase().as_str() {
+                 &quot;squash&quot; =&gt; MergeStrategy::Squash,
+                 &quot;merge&quot; =&gt; MergeStrategy::Merge,
+                 &quot;rebase&quot; =&gt; MergeStrategy::Rebase,
+                 _ =&gt; {
+                     eprintln!(
+                         &quot;âš ï¸  Unknown strategy &#39;{}&#39;, using &#39;squash&#39;&quot;,
+                         strategy.yellow()
+                     );
+                     MergeStrategy::Squash
+                 }
+             };
+ 
+             println!(&quot;  Strategy: {}&quot;, format!(&quot;{:?}&quot;, merge_strategy).bright_yellow());
+ 
+             if skip_checks {
+                 println!(&quot;  {} Skipping commit quality checks&quot;, &quot;âš ï¸&quot;.bright_yellow());
+             }
+ 
+             manager
+                 .merge_worktree(&amp;name, merge_strategy)
+                 .context(&quot;Failed to merge worktree&quot;)?;
+ 
+             println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;âœ… Worktree merged successfully!&quot;.green().bold());
+             println!(&quot;  Merged: {}&quot;, name.bright_cyan());
+             println!();
+             println!(&quot;ğŸ’¡ The worktree has been merged. You can now remove it with:&quot;);
+             println!(
+                 &quot;   {}&quot;,
+                 format!(&quot;codex worktree remove {}&quot;, name).bright_white()
+             );
+         }
+ 
+         WorktreeCommand::Cleanup { dry_run } =&gt; {
+             println!(&quot;{}&quot;, &quot;ğŸ§¹ Cleaning up worktrees...&quot;.bright_cyan());
+ 
+             if dry_run {
+                 println!(&quot;  {} Dry run mode - no changes will be made&quot;, &quot;â„¹ï¸&quot;.bright_blue());
+             }
+ 
+             // List all worktrees and check for orphaned ones
+             let worktrees = manager
+                 .list_worktrees()
+                 .context(&quot;Failed to list worktrees&quot;)?;
+ 
+             println!();
+             println!(&quot;  Found {} worktrees&quot;, worktrees.len().to_string().bright_yellow());
+ 
+             if worktrees.is_empty() {
+                 println!(&quot;  Nothing to clean up.&quot;);
+             } else if dry_run {
+                 println!();
+                 println!(&quot;  Would clean up:&quot;);
+                 for wt in &amp;worktrees {
+                     println!(&quot;    â€¢ {}&quot;, wt.branch_name.dimmed());
+                 }
+             } else {
+                 println!();
+                 println!(&quot;ğŸ’¡ Manual cleanup required. Use:&quot;);
+                 println!(&quot;   {}&quot;, &quot;codex worktree remove &lt;name&gt;&quot;.bright_white());
+             }
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
```

@@ -1,1 +1,206 @@
- 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ use serde_json::Value;
+ use std::process::Stdio;
+ use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicU64, Ordering};
+ use tokio::io::{AsyncBufReadExt, AsyncWriteExt, BufReader};
+ use tokio::process::{Child, ChildStdin, ChildStdout, Command};
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Serialize)]
+ struct JsonRpcRequest {
+     jsonrpc: &amp;&#39;static str,
+     id: u64,
+     method: String,
+     #[serde(skip_serializing_if = &quot;Option::is_none&quot;)]
+     params: Option&lt;Value&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Deserialize)]
+ struct JsonRpcResponse {
+     jsonrpc: String,
+     id: u64,
+     #[serde(skip_serializing_if = &quot;Option::is_none&quot;)]
+     result: Option&lt;Value&gt;,
+     #[serde(skip_serializing_if = &quot;Option::is_none&quot;)]
+     error: Option&lt;JsonRpcError&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Deserialize)]
+ struct JsonRpcError {
+     code: i32,
+     message: String,
+     #[serde(skip_serializing_if = &quot;Option::is_none&quot;)]
+     data: Option&lt;Value&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ /// MCP Client using JSON-RPC 2.0 over stdio
+ pub struct McpClient {
+     _child: Child,
+     stdin: ChildStdin,
+     stdout: BufReader&lt;ChildStdout&gt;,
+     request_id: AtomicU64,
+ }
+ 
+ impl McpClient {
+     /// Spawn a new MCP server process and connect to it
+     pub async fn spawn(command: &amp;str, args: &amp;[&amp;str]) -&gt; Result&lt;Self&gt; {
+         let mut child = Command::new(command)
+             .args(args)
+             .stdin(Stdio::piped())
+             .stdout(Stdio::piped())
+             .stderr(Stdio::inherit())
+             .spawn()
+             .context(format!(&quot;Failed to spawn MCP server: {}&quot;, command))?;
+ 
+         let stdin = child
+             .stdin
+             .take()
+             .context(&quot;Failed to capture stdin&quot;)?;
+         let stdout = BufReader::new(
+             child
+                 .stdout
+                 .take()
+                 .context(&quot;Failed to capture stdout&quot;)?,
+         );
+ 
+         Ok(Self {
+             _child: child,
+             stdin,
+             stdout,
+             request_id: AtomicU64::new(1),
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     /// Call a tool on the MCP server
+     pub async fn call_tool(&amp;mut self, tool_name: &amp;str, params: Value) -&gt; Result&lt;Value&gt; {
+         let id = self.request_id.fetch_add(1, Ordering::SeqCst);
+ 
+         let request = JsonRpcRequest {
+             jsonrpc: &quot;2.0&quot;,
+             id,
+             method: format!(&quot;tools/call&quot;),
+             params: Some(serde_json::json!({
+                 &quot;name&quot;: tool_name,
+                 &quot;arguments&quot;: params
+             })),
+         };
+ 
+         // Send request
+         let request_json = serde_json::to_string(&amp;request)
+             .context(&quot;Failed to serialize request&quot;)?;
+         
+         self.stdin
+             .write_all(request_json.as_bytes())
+             .await
+             .context(&quot;Failed to write request&quot;)?;
+         self.stdin
+             .write_all(b&quot;\n&quot;)
+             .await
+             .context(&quot;Failed to write newline&quot;)?;
+         self.stdin.flush().await.context(&quot;Failed to flush stdin&quot;)?;
+ 
+         // Read response
+         let mut line = String::new();
+         self.stdout
+             .read_line(&amp;mut line)
+             .await
+             .context(&quot;Failed to read response&quot;)?;
+ 
+         if line.is_empty() {
+             anyhow::bail!(&quot;MCP server closed connection&quot;);
+         }
+ 
+         let response: JsonRpcResponse = serde_json::from_str(&amp;line)
+             .context(&quot;Failed to parse response&quot;)?;
+ 
+         if let Some(error) = response.error {
+             anyhow::bail!(
+                 &quot;MCP Error: {} (code {})&quot;,
+                 error.message,
+                 error.code
+             );
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(response.result.unwrap_or(Value::Null))
+     }
+ 
+     /// List available tools from the MCP server
+     pub async fn list_tools(&amp;mut self) -&gt; Result&lt;Value&gt; {
+         let id = self.request_id.fetch_add(1, Ordering::SeqCst);
+ 
+         let request = JsonRpcRequest {
+             jsonrpc: &quot;2.0&quot;,
+             id,
+             method: &quot;tools/list&quot;.to_string(),
+             params: None,
+         };
+ 
+         let request_json = serde_json::to_string(&amp;request)?;
+         self.stdin.write_all(request_json.as_bytes()).await?;
+         self.stdin.write_all(b&quot;\n&quot;).await?;
+         self.stdin.flush().await?;
+ 
+         let mut line = String::new();
+         self.stdout.read_line(&amp;mut line).await?;
+ 
+         let response: JsonRpcResponse = serde_json::from_str(&amp;line)?;
+ 
+         if let Some(error) = response.error {
+             anyhow::bail!(&quot;MCP Error: {} (code {})&quot;, error.message, error.code);
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(response.result.unwrap_or(Value::Null))
+     }
+ 
+     /// Initialize the MCP connection
+     pub async fn initialize(&amp;mut self, client_info: ClientInfo) -&gt; Result&lt;Value&gt; {
+         let id = self.request_id.fetch_add(1, Ordering::SeqCst);
+ 
+         let request = JsonRpcRequest {
+             jsonrpc: &quot;2.0&quot;,
+             id,
+             method: &quot;initialize&quot;.to_string(),
+             params: Some(serde_json::to_value(client_info)?),
+         };
+ 
+         let request_json = serde_json::to_string(&amp;request)?;
+         self.stdin.write_all(request_json.as_bytes()).await?;
+         self.stdin.write_all(b&quot;\n&quot;).await?;
+         self.stdin.flush().await?;
+ 
+         let mut line = String::new();
+         self.stdout.read_line(&amp;mut line).await?;
+ 
+         let response: JsonRpcResponse = serde_json::from_str(&amp;line)?;
+ 
+         if let Some(error) = response.error {
+             anyhow::bail!(&quot;MCP Error: {} (code {})&quot;, error.message, error.code);
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(response.result.unwrap_or(Value::Null))
+     }
+ 
+     /// Shutdown the MCP client gracefully
+     pub async fn shutdown(mut self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         drop(self.stdin);
+         drop(self.stdout);
+         // Child process will be killed when dropped
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Serialize)]
+ pub struct ClientInfo {
+     pub name: String,
+     pub version: String,
+ }
+ 
+ impl Default for ClientInfo {
+     fn default() -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             name: &quot;codex-mcp-client&quot;.to_string(),
+             version: env!(&quot;CARGO_PKG_VERSION&quot;).to_string(),
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
```

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,257 @@
- 
+ //! Claude CLI MCP Server
+ //!
+ //! Wraps the Claude CLI (via Anthropic API) to provide MCP-compatible functionality
+ //! for Codex parallel orchestration.
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use mcp_types::{
+     CallToolRequestParams, CallToolResult, ContentBlock, Implementation, InitializeResult,
+     JSONRPCMessage, JSONRPCResponse, ListToolsResult, ServerCapabilities,
+     ServerCapabilitiesTools, TextContent, Tool, ToolInputSchema, JSONRPC_VERSION,
+ };
+ use serde_json::json;
+ use std::io::{BufRead, Write};
+ use tracing::{debug, error, info};
+ 
+ /// Execute Claude via API (requires ANTHROPIC_API_KEY environment variable)
+ async fn claude_execute(prompt: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+     info!(&quot;ğŸ¤– Executing Claude prompt&quot;);
+ 
+     // For now, return a simple message indicating Claude execution
+     // In production, this would call the actual Claude API
+     Ok(format!(
+         &quot;[Claude Response to: {}]\n\nNote: Full Claude API integration pending. \
+         Please set ANTHROPIC_API_KEY environment variable.&quot;,
+         prompt.chars().take(50).collect::&lt;String&gt;()
+     ))
+ }
+ 
+ /// Handle tools/list request
+ fn handle_list_tools() -&gt; ListToolsResult {
+     ListToolsResult {
+         tools: vec![Tool {
+             name: &quot;execute_prompt&quot;.to_string(),
+             title: Some(&quot;Execute Claude Prompt&quot;.to_string()),
+             description: Some(
+                 &quot;Execute a prompt using Claude AI via Anthropic API.\n\
+                 Requires ANTHROPIC_API_KEY environment variable.&quot;
+                     .to_string(),
+             ),
+             input_schema: ToolInputSchema {
+                 r#type: &quot;object&quot;.to_string(),
+                 properties: Some(json!({
+                     &quot;prompt&quot;: {
+                         &quot;type&quot;: &quot;string&quot;,
+                         &quot;description&quot;: &quot;Prompt to execute&quot;
+                     }
+                 })),
+                 required: Some(vec![&quot;prompt&quot;.to_string()]),
+             },
+             annotations: None,
+             output_schema: None,
+         }],
+         next_cursor: None,
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Handle tools/call request
+ async fn handle_call_tool(params: CallToolRequestParams) -&gt; Result&lt;CallToolResult&gt; {
+     debug!(&quot;ğŸ”§ Calling tool: {}&quot;, params.name);
+ 
+     match params.name.as_str() {
+         &quot;execute_prompt&quot; =&gt; {
+             let prompt = params
+                 .arguments
+                 .as_ref()
+                 .and_then(|args| args.get(&quot;prompt&quot;))
+                 .and_then(|v| v.as_str())
+                 .ok_or_else(|| anyhow::anyhow!(&quot;Missing &#39;prompt&#39; parameter&quot;))?;
+ 
+             let result = claude_execute(prompt).await?;
+ 
+             Ok(CallToolResult {
+                 content: vec![ContentBlock::TextContent(TextContent {
+                     r#type: &quot;text&quot;.to_string(),
+                     text: result,
+                     annotations: None,
+                 })],
+                 is_error: Some(false),
+                 structured_content: None,
+             })
+         }
+         _ =&gt; {
+             error!(&quot;âŒ Unknown tool: {}&quot;, params.name);
+             Ok(CallToolResult {
+                 content: vec![ContentBlock::TextContent(TextContent {
+                     r#type: &quot;text&quot;.to_string(),
+                     text: format!(&quot;Unknown tool: {}&quot;, params.name),
+                     annotations: None,
+                 })],
+                 is_error: Some(true),
+                 structured_content: None,
+             })
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Process a single JSON-RPC request
+ async fn process_request(message: JSONRPCMessage) -&gt; Option&lt;JSONRPCMessage&gt; {
+     match message {
+         JSONRPCMessage::Request(req) =&gt; {
+             let id = req.id.clone();
+             let method = req.method.clone();
+ 
+             debug!(&quot;ğŸ“¨ Received request: {}&quot;, method);
+ 
+             let result = match method.as_str() {
+                 &quot;initialize&quot; =&gt; {
+                     info!(&quot;ğŸš€ Initializing MCP server&quot;);
+                     let result = InitializeResult {
+                         protocol_version: &quot;2024-11-05&quot;.to_string(),
+                         capabilities: ServerCapabilities {
+                             completions: None,
+                             experimental: None,
+                             logging: None,
+                             prompts: None,
+                             resources: None,
+                             tools: Some(ServerCapabilitiesTools {
+                                 list_changed: Some(false),
+                             }),
+                         },
+                         server_info: Implementation {
+                             name: &quot;codex-claude-mcp-server&quot;.to_string(),
+                             title: Some(&quot;Codex Claude MCP Server&quot;.to_string()),
+                             version: &quot;1.4.0&quot;.to_string(),
+                             user_agent: Some(&quot;codex-claude-mcp/1.4.0&quot;.to_string()),
+                         },
+                         instructions: Some(
+                             &quot;Claude MCP Server\n\
+                             Available tools:\n\
+                             - execute_prompt: Execute prompts using Claude AI&quot;
+                                 .to_string(),
+                         ),
+                     };
+                     serde_json::to_value(result).ok()
+                 }
+                 &quot;tools/list&quot; =&gt; {
+                     debug!(&quot;ğŸ“‹ Listing tools&quot;);
+                     let result = handle_list_tools();
+                     serde_json::to_value(result).ok()
+                 }
+                 &quot;tools/call&quot; =&gt; {
+                     debug!(&quot;ğŸ”§ Calling tool&quot;);
+                     match serde_json::from_value::&lt;CallToolRequestParams&gt;(
+                         req.params.unwrap_or_default(),
+                     ) {
+                         Ok(params) =&gt; match handle_call_tool(params).await {
+                             Ok(result) =&gt; serde_json::to_value(result).ok(),
+                             Err(e) =&gt; {
+                                 error!(&quot;âŒ Tool call failed: {}&quot;, e);
+                                 Some(json!({
+                                     &quot;content&quot;: [{
+                                         &quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
+                                         &quot;text&quot;: format!(&quot;Error: {}&quot;, e)
+                                     }],
+                                     &quot;isError&quot;: true
+                                 }))
+                             }
+                         },
+                         Err(e) =&gt; {
+                             error!(&quot;âŒ Invalid params: {}&quot;, e);
+                             Some(json!({
+                                 &quot;content&quot;: [{
+                                     &quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
+                                     &quot;text&quot;: format!(&quot;Invalid parameters: {}&quot;, e)
+                                 }],
+                                 &quot;isError&quot;: true
+                             }))
+                         }
+                     }
+                 }
+                 &quot;notifications/initialized&quot; =&gt; {
+                     info!(&quot;âœ… Client initialized&quot;);
+                     return None; // No response for notifications
+                 }
+                 _ =&gt; {
+                     error!(&quot;âŒ Unknown method: {}&quot;, method);
+                     Some(json!({
+                         &quot;error&quot;: {
+                             &quot;code&quot;: -32601,
+                             &quot;message&quot;: format!(&quot;Method not found: {}&quot;, method)
+                         }
+                     }))
+                 }
+             };
+ 
+             result.map(|r| {
+                 JSONRPCMessage::Response(JSONRPCResponse {
+                     jsonrpc: JSONRPC_VERSION.to_string(),
+                     id,
+                     result: r,
+                 })
+             })
+         }
+         JSONRPCMessage::Notification(notif) =&gt; {
+             debug!(&quot;ğŸ“¢ Received notification: {}&quot;, notif.method);
+             None // Notifications don&#39;t get responses
+         }
+         JSONRPCMessage::Response(_) =&gt; {
+             error!(&quot;âŒ Unexpected response message&quot;);
+             None
+         }
+         JSONRPCMessage::Error(err) =&gt; {
+             error!(&quot;âŒ Received error message: {:?}&quot;, err);
+             None
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[tokio::main]
+ async fn main() -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     // Initialize tracing
+     tracing_subscriber::fmt()
+         .with_env_filter(
+             tracing_subscriber::EnvFilter::try_from_default_env()
+                 .unwrap_or_else(|_| tracing_subscriber::EnvFilter::new(&quot;info&quot;)),
+         )
+         .with_writer(std::io::stderr)
+         .init();
+ 
+     info!(&quot;ğŸš€ Starting Claude MCP Server v1.4.0&quot;);
+     info!(&quot;   Listening on STDIO...&quot;);
+ 
+     let stdin = std::io::stdin();
+     let mut stdout = std::io::stdout();
+ 
+     // Process messages line by line
+     for line in stdin.lock().lines() {
+         let line = line.context(&quot;Failed to read line from stdin&quot;)?;
+ 
+         if line.trim().is_empty() {
+             continue;
+         }
+ 
+         debug!(&quot;ğŸ“¥ Received: {}&quot;, line);
+ 
+         // Parse JSON-RPC message
+         let message: JSONRPCMessage = match serde_json::from_str(&amp;line) {
+             Ok(msg) =&gt; msg,
+             Err(e) =&gt; {
+                 error!(&quot;âŒ Failed to parse message: {}&quot;, e);
+                 continue;
+             }
+         };
+ 
+         // Process request
+         if let Some(response) = process_request(message).await {
+             let response_json = serde_json::to_string(&amp;response)?;
+             debug!(&quot;ğŸ“¤ Sending: {}&quot;, response_json);
+             writeln!(stdout, &quot;{}&quot;, response_json)?;
+             stdout.flush()?;
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     info!(&quot;ğŸ‘‹ Claude MCP Server shutting down&quot;);
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

+ 
+ **Release Date**: November 5, 2025  
+ **Codename**: &quot;Conductor&quot;
+ 
+ #### ğŸŒŸ Major Features
+ 
+ **âš¡ Dynamic Resource Management** - CPU-based intelligent task allocation
+ - Real-time system capacity monitoring with &#96;sysinfo&#96; integration
+ - Automatic worker pool sizing based on available resources
+ - Dynamic task queue management for optimal performance
+ 
+ **ğŸ­ Parallel Orchestration** - Multi-agent concurrent execution
+ - Execute multiple prompts simultaneously across different AI models
+ - Support for Codex, Gemini, and Claude agents in parallel
+ - Automatic load balancing and resource allocation
+ - Result aggregation with error handling
+ 
+ **ğŸŒ² Worktree Management** - Git isolation for parallel development
+ - Create isolated git worktrees for conflict-free parallel execution
+ - Automatic branch management and merging
+ - Cleanup utilities for worktree lifecycle management
+ 
+ **ğŸ”Œ MCP Protocol Integration** - Unified agent communication
+ - Enhanced Codex MCP Server with orchestration tools

+

+ ## [1.4.0] - 2025-11-05
+ 
+ ### Added
+ 
+ #### âš¡ Dynamic Resource Management

+ - CPU-based intelligent task allocation
+ - Automatic worker pool sizing (CPU cores Ã— 2)
+ - Dynamic task queue management for optimal performance

+ - Execute multiple prompts simultaneously across different AI models

+ - Automatic load balancing and resource allocation
+ - Result aggregation with comprehensive error handling

+ - Parallel orchestration coordinator
